column4: I installed a module, but now when I try to modprobe it, it says Not Found. :/ What can I do?
try:   modprobe -l | grep POSSIBLEMODULENAME
Yeah, it's not listed there
how did you install the module?
I had the source, did make, make install, no errors. Though there was no output for make install O_o That's all it says to do
that typically won't work in ubuntu
because the way that it builds and install modules is different from most distros
how so? :/ Hmm... even different from Debian?
you will need the kernel source (headers MAY work) or your currently running config to /usr/src/linux
not different then debian
Uuuggghh so I have to recompile the whole kernel?
no, but you need the headers/source of your currently running kernel
in fact, recompiling the kernel in ubuntu, ofthen just breaks apt-get when installing modules
and highly not recommended
hmmm I have linux-headers-26etcetc installed. Hmmm I can't install the module from apt-get because its not available there
what driver is it?
lmpcm_usb
which is?
Logitech MediaPlay mouse drivers
when you did make install, what kernel source headers did it use?
the one I'm running now
my only guess, is you need to full kernel source, and not just the headers
